<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/16/space-jam-reboot-offers-grand-tour-warner-bros-ip?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Everybody Get Up It’s Time to Spend Now
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Space Jam 2 image" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81ODE0L3NwYWNlX2phbV8yX2ltYWdlLmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Warner Bros.</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This is not a review of the film <em>Space Jam: A New Legacy</em>, which opened in US theaters and on HBO Max yesterday. It <em>is</em> a review of how Warner Bros. positioned the reboot to extract as much value from its various franchises as possible, making the movie the biggest marketing event of the summer. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Warner Bros. linked up with more than <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-16/-space-jam-brand-tie-ins-include-nike-amazon-mcdonald-s-uber?sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">200 partners</a> in its promotion of the film, per a Bloomberg tally. That includes McDonald’s Happy Meals, BarkBox chew toys for pets, and, surely the most expensive piece of co-branded merchandise, a <a href="https://hypebeast.com/2021/7/meet-the-100000-usd-space-jam-a-new-legacy-tourbillon-collector-set?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$100,000 watch set</a> from Swiss brand Kross Studio.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Of course, shameless commercialization is in <em>Space Jam</em>’s DNA. The original movie from 1996, starring Michael Jordan, was inspired by a <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oEr1Askbay0" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Nike Super Bowl commercial</a> from three years earlier. While the first film made more than $230 million at the global box office, it generated more than 5x that ($1.2 billion) in merchandise revenue. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">This time, Warner Bros. is going bigger</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But it’s less about directly selling merchandise than giving viewers a tour of its various franchises. “<em>Space Jam: A New Legacy</em> isn’t really a movie—it’s a crash course in vertical integration and brand identity, a marketing slideshow with a two-hour running time,” writes <a href="https://www.polygon.com/movies/22577229/space-jam-a-new-legacy-review?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Polygon</a>.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The movie title says “Space Jam,” but in addition to star LeBron James and the Looney Tunes, you’ll find cameos by Harry Potter, the </span><span><em>Wizard of Oz</em></span><span> cyclone, the Iron Giant, Pennywise the Clown, and even Rick's Café from </span><span><em>Casablanca</em></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>With media companies building war chests of content to best each other in the streaming wars, expect more crossover events like this one. As Jake Harris <a href="https://bookandfilmglobe.com/film/space-jam-exists-to-take-your-money/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes</a> in the Book and Film Globe, “Everyone’s got to have a cinematic universe these days, after all.” </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/16/secretary-yellen-meet-us-regulators-discuss-stablecoin?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Regulators Want a Firm Stance on Stablecoin
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Someone brought up the word “stablecoin” in the financial regulator group chat and it’s been unmanageable ever since. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen decided to take the convo live and said she’ll <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/07/16/treasury-secy-janet-yellen-to-discuss-stablecoins-with-regulators-next-week-.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">meet</a> with prominent finance officials on Monday to discuss this version of cryptocurrency.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What is stablecoin?</strong> It’s a coin that is—in theory—more stable than other cryptocurrencies like bitcoin, ether, etc., because it’s tied to government-issued money like the US dollar or assets like gold. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>US regulators are particularly unsure about USD backed crypto and the already $100+ billion in stablecoin flying around.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">During next week’s meeting, Secretary Yellen and other regulators will ask themselves: If there is no oversight of these US dollar-backed coins, what does that mean for the OG US dollar?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> Finance chiefs have been discussing how to regulate what has until now been the Wild West. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell told Congress this week that there is <a href="https://news.yahoo.com/fed-powell-says-legitimately-undecided-183900174.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">some incentive</a> for the US to launch its own central bank digital currency (CBDC) to circumvent all other 11,000+ cryptos, but he’s undecided if the pros outweigh the costs.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GEOPOLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/16/us-warns-companies-rising-risks-operating-hong-kong?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
US Businesses Warned About Hong Kong
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Hong Kong skyline" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81ODE4L2hvbmdfa29uZ19za3lsaW5lLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>DALE DE LA REY/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The US Departments of State, Commerce, Homeland Security, and Treasury <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-warns-businesses-over-rising-risks-in-hong-kong-under-china-crackdown-11626429600?mod=hp_lead_pos2" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">warned</a> American companies of serious risks when operating in Hong Kong as the Chinese government tightens its grip on the global financial hub. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“Beijing has chipped away at Hong Kong’s reputation of accountable, transparent governance and respect for individual freedoms, and has broken its promise to leave Hong Kong’s high degree of autonomy unchanged for 50 years,” Secretary of State Antony Blinken said in a statement.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a <a href="https://home.treasury.gov/system/files/126/20210716_hong_kong_advisory.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">business advisory</a> issued yesterday, the US government listed the threats US companies in Hong Kong might face:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Electronic surveillance and compromised data security</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Risks regarding transparency and access to critical business information</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Deteriorating press freedom</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A new Chinese national security law that targets political dissidents</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead</strong>…the advisory won’t demand specific actions from private companies. Instead it aims to assist them in making “informed business decisions and properly assessing risks.” But after a series of crackdowns on Hong Kong by the Chinese government since 2019, many American businesses are eyeing an exit. </p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/16/key-performance-indicators-july-17?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Xiaomi, a Chinese manufacturer, leapt past Apple to become the <a href="https://www.canalys.com/newsroom/global-smartphone-market-q2-2021?ctid=2143-0b9f92413ead631983febced55e12cd8" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">second-largest</a> smartphone vendor in the world last quarter, per Canalys. With 17% market share, it’s causing No. 1 Samsung (19%) to sweat. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“This is becoming a pandemic of the unvaccinated.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">CDC Director Rochelle Walensky said that the Delta variant is <a href="https://thehill.com/policy/healthcare/563391-cdc-director-warns-of-pandemic-of-the-unvaccinated-as-cases-rise?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spreading quickly</a> among unvaccinated people in the US. Cases are up 70%, hospitalizations have increased 36%, and deaths are up 26% from the prior week, Walensky said. 97% of people hospitalized due to Covid-19 are unvaccinated. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong><em>Welcome 2 America</em>: The oral history of Prince’s lost album. (<a href="https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-features/prince-welcome-2-america-lost-album-oral-history-1192233/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Rolling Stone</a>)</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MONEY MATTERS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/17/money-matters-many-credit-cards-many?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Money Matters: How Many Credit Cards Is too Many?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/17/money-matters-many-credit-cards-many?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Credit cards" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81ODE3L2NyZWRpdF9jYXJkcy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>In this new Summer 2021 segment, the Brew’s personal finance writer Ryan Lasker is nose-diving into our inbox to address your personal finance questions. </em><a href="https://link.morningbrew.com/click/24127283.23936/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9tMDZUYmRVUz91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77B5ca46cdd?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Submit your money woes here</em></a><em>.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How many credit cards should I have, and is it OK to close one if I never used it and have no balance?—Eduardo from New York</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The question isn’t <em>how many</em> credit cards you should have, but rather how much of your total credit limit you’re using. The goal is to keep your card balances below 30% of their combined limit. If you have just one credit card with a $1,000 limit, stay sub-$300, even when you pay in full and on time.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s a balancing act: You want enough credit to keep your utilization low, but you don’t want so many cards that you’ll lose track of them or be tempted to order shots for the whole bar.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Need more credit?</strong> Request a limit increase on a current card or open a new card. Both could trigger hard credit checks (bad for credit scores) so take six months between asks. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But don’t let me discourage you from opening a new card and using free points to take a flight to Europe. Credit card rewards can pack a serious punch.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As for your second question, it’s fine to close credit cards you no longer use—especially if there’s an annual fee—<em>unless</em><strong style="color:#000"> </strong>it’s your first. Credit scores factor in how long you’ve had credit, and closing your oldest account could send your scores down the ski slope with a slow chairlift back up.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"><em>P.S.:</em></strong><em> Later this summer, Ryan will be writing a twice-weekly personal finance newsletter to make you smarter about your money. </em><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/money-scoop/subscribe?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Become one of the first subscribers</em></a><em>.</em></p>

Brew's Bookshelf

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Every other week, Brew’s Bookshelf brings you a few of our favorite, (usually) business-related reads. </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In </span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9781538728727?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Haben</em></a></span><span>, lawyer, disability activist, and the first deafblind graduate of Harvard Law School Haben Girma shares the inspiring story of how she not only succeeded in institutions that were never built for her, but also created a more accessible and equitable path in her wake.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Nicholas Schmidle’s </span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9781250229755?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Test Gods</em></a></span><span> profiles the people who made Virgin Galactic's space launch possible. </span>
</li>
</ol>
</td>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">New words: </strong>Dictionary.com added more than 300 new words and definitions, from “long Covid” to “zaddy.” <a href="https://www.dictionary.com/e/new-dictionary-words-summer-2021/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check them out</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Weekend conversation starters: </strong></p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nMARKETING \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/16/space-jam-reboot-offers-grand-tour-warner-bros-ip?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nEverybody Get Up It’s Time to Spend Now\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Space Jam 2 image\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81ODE0L3NwYWNlX2phbV8yX2ltYWdlLmpwZWciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eWarner Bros.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis is not a review of the film \u003cem\u003eSpace Jam: A New Legacy\u003c/em\u003e, which opened in US theaters and on HBO Max yesterday. It \u003cem\u003eis\u003c/em\u003e a review of how Warner Bros. positioned the reboot to extract as much value from its various franchises as possible, making the movie the biggest marketing event of the summer. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWarner Bros. linked up with more than \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-16/-space-jam-brand-tie-ins-include-nike-amazon-mcdonald-s-uber?sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e200 partners\u003c/a\u003e in its promotion of the film, per a Bloomberg tally. That includes McDonald’s Happy Meals, BarkBox chew toys for pets, and, surely the most expensive piece of co-branded merchandise, a \u003ca href=\"https://hypebeast.com/2021/7/meet-the-100000-usd-space-jam-a-new-legacy-tourbillon-collector-set?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$100,000 watch set\u003c/a\u003e from Swiss brand Kross Studio.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOf course, shameless commercialization is in \u003cem\u003eSpace Jam\u003c/em\u003e’s DNA. The original movie from 1996, starring Michael Jordan, was inspired by a \u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oEr1Askbay0\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNike Super Bowl commercial\u003c/a\u003e from three years earlier. While the first film made more than $230 million at the global box office, it generated more than 5x that ($1.2 billion) in merchandise revenue. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThis time, Warner Bros. is going bigger\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut it’s less about directly selling merchandise than giving viewers a tour of its various franchises. “\u003cem\u003eSpace Jam: A New Legacy\u003c/em\u003e isn’t really a movie—it’s a crash course in vertical integration and brand identity, a marketing slideshow with a two-hour running time,” writes \u003ca href=\"https://www.polygon.com/movies/22577229/space-jam-a-new-legacy-review?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ePolygon\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe movie title says “Space Jam,” but in addition to star LeBron James and the Looney Tunes, you’ll find cameos by Harry Potter, the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eWizard of Oz\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e cyclone, the Iron Giant, Pennywise the Clown, and even Rick's Café from \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eCasablanca\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eWith media companies building war chests of content to best each other in the streaming wars, expect more crossover events like this one. As Jake Harris \u003ca href=\"https://bookandfilmglobe.com/film/space-jam-exists-to-take-your-money/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites\u003c/a\u003e in the Book and Film Globe, “Everyone’s got to have a cinematic universe these days, after all.” \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd Stablecoin\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSomeone brought up the word “stablecoin” in the financial regulator group chat and it’s been unmanageable ever since. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen decided to take the convo live and said she’ll \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/07/16/treasury-secy-janet-yellen-to-discuss-stablecoins-with-regulators-next-week-.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emeet\u003c/a\u003e with prominent finance officials on Monday to discuss this version of cryptocurrency.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat is stablecoin?\u003c/strong\u003e It’s a coin that is—in theory—more stable than other cryptocurrencies like bitcoin, ether, etc., because it’s tied to government-issued money like the US dollar or assets like gold. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUS regulators are particularly unsure about USD backed crypto and the already $100+ billion in stablecoin flying around.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDuring next week’s meeting, Secretary Yellen and other regulators will ask themselves: If there is no oversight of these US dollar-backed coins, what does that mean for the OG US dollar?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e Finance chiefs have been discussing how to regulate what has until now been the Wild West. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell told Congress this week that there is \u003ca href=\"https://news.yahoo.com/fed-powell-says-legitimately-undecided-183900174.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esome incentive\u003c/a\u003e for the US to launch its own central bank digital currency (CBDC) to circumvent all other 11,000+ cryptos, but he’s undecided if the pros outweigh the costs.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eElectronic surveillance and compromised data freedom\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA new Chinese national security law that targets political dissidents\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead\u003c/strong\u003e…the advisory won’t demand specific actions from private companies. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eIn this new Summer 2021 segment, the Brew’s personal finance writer Ryan Lasker is nose-diving into our inbox to address your personal finance questions. \u003c/em\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://link.morningbrew.com/click/24127283.23936/aHR0cHM6Ly9tb3JuaW5nYnJld2RhaWx5LnR5cGVmb3JtLmNvbS90by9tMDZUYmRVUz91dG1fc291cmNlPW1vcm5pbmdfYnJldw/5c881db32ddf9c27c11a8f77B5ca46cdd?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eSubmit your money woes here\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003cem\u003e.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow many credit cards should I have, and is it OK to close one if I never used it and have no balance?—Eduardo from New York\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe question isn’t \u003cem\u003ehow many\u003c/em\u003e credit cards you should have, but rather how much of your total credit limit you’re using. The goal is to keep your card balances below 30% of their combined limit. If you have just one credit card with a $1,000 limit, stay sub-$300, even when you pay in full and on time.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s a balancing act: You want enough credit to keep your utilization low, but you don’t want so many cards that you’ll lose track of them or be tempted to order shots for the whole bar.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNeed more credit?\u003c/strong\u003e Request a limit increase on a current card or open a new card. Both could trigger hard credit checks (bad for credit scores) so take six months between asks. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut don’t let me discourage you from opening a new card and using free points to take a flight to Europe. Credit card rewards can pack a serious punch.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs for your second question, it’s fine to close credit cards you no longer use—especially if there’s an annual fee—\u003cem\u003eunless\u003c/em\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eit’s your first. Credit scores factor in how long you’ve had credit, and closing your oldest account could send your scores down the ski slope with a slow chairlift back up.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eP.S.:\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cem\u003e Later this summer, Ryan will
